Sentencas: This paper proposes a novel solid oxide steam electrolyser with in-situ hydrogen storage by integrating a magnesium hydride (MH) section with proton-conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) section.
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study

Sentencas: Dynamic simulation results show that it takes 1950 s to fully charge the MH section with a 56% H-2 storage efficiency without any flow recirculation, when the electrolyser is operated at 1.4 V and 4 atm, yielding a current density of 4956.40 A/m(2).
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study

Sentencas: The evolution of temperature, H-2 partial pressure and reaction of Mg powder through the charging process are analysed.
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study

Sentencas: It is found that the exothermic H-2 absorption process of MH section can enhance the performance of the electrolysis process of SOEC section.
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study

Sentencas: The effects of operating parameters including operating pressure, electrolysis voltage, and cooling air temperature on the performance of the novel design are investigated by sensitivity studies.
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study

Sentencas: Results show that it is beneficial to operate the electrolyser at elevated pressure for shorter absorption time and higher H-2 storage efficiency.
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study

Sentencas: Increasing the operating voltage can shorten the absorption time, but lower H-2 storage efficiency.
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study

Sentencas: An optimal cooling air temperature is found at 521 K when the electrolyser is operated at 1.4 V and 4 atm.
Titulo: A novel design of solid oxide electrolyser integrated with magnesium hydride bed for hydrogen generation and storage - A dynamic simulation study
